destiny.core

Class FadeGif

  • java.lang.Object
    • destiny.core.FadeGif

  • public class FadeGif
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses the existing PGif class and adds fading functionality to it
    Version:
    12/5/2020
    Author:
    Nathaniel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FadeGif(PGif gif)
      Create a FadeGif from PGif object
      FadeGif(PGif gif, float startTint, float targetTint, float fadeSpeed)
      Creates a FadeGif with the given specifications starting from an already existing gif
      FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname)
      Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path placed at (0,0) with no starting tint and a target tint of pure black
      FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname, float startTint, float targetTint, float fadeSpeed)
      Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and fade speed and opacities placed at (0,0)
      FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname, int x, int y)
      Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and places it at the desired top left corner
      FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname, int x, int y, float startTint, float targetTint, float fadeSpeed)
      Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and fade speed and opacities and top left corner coordinates
      FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and desired dimension of the GIF
      FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname, int x, int y, int width, int height, float startTint, float targetTint, float fadeSpeed)
      Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and desired dimension of the GIF and fade speed and opacities

    • Constructor Detail

      • FadeGif

        public FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname)
        Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path placed at (0,0) with no starting tint and a target tint of pure black
        Parameters:
        pathname - The location of the gif file

      • FadeGif

        public FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname,
               int x,
               int y)
        Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and places it at the desired top left corner
        Parameters:
        pathname - The location of the gif file
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of where the gif should be placed
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of where the gif should be placed

      • FadeGif

        public FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname,
               float startTint,
               float targetTint,
               float fadeSpeed)
        Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and fade speed and opacities placed at (0,0)
        Parameters:
        pathname - The location of the gif file
        startTint - The starting tint of the FadeGif
        targetTint - The target tint of the FadeGif
        fadeSpeed - The speed at which the gif should fade at. This is the value the tint is changed by every frame

      • FadeGif

        public FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
        Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and desired dimension of the GIF
        Parameters:
        pathname - The location of the gif file
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of where the gif should be placed
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of where the gif should be placed
        width - The desired width of the gif
        height - The desired height of the gif

      • FadeGif

        public FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height,
               float startTint,
               float targetTint,
               float fadeSpeed)
        Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and desired dimension of the GIF and fade speed and opacities
        Parameters:
        pathname - The location of the gif file
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of where the gif should be placed
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of where the gif should be placed
        width - The desired width of the gif
        height - The desired height of the gif
        startTint - The starting tint of the FadeGif
        targetTint - The target tint of the FadeGif
        fadeSpeed - The speed at which the gif should fade at. This is the value the tint is changed by every frame

      • FadeGif

        public FadeGif(java.lang.String pathname,
               int x,
               int y,
               float startTint,
               float targetTint,
               float fadeSpeed)
        Create a FadeGif by retrieving a GIF from a path and fade speed and opacities and top left corner coordinates
        Parameters:
        pathname - The location of the gif file
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of where the gif should be placed
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of where the gif should be placed
        startTint - The starting tint of the FadeGif
        targetTint - The target tint of the FadeGif
        fadeSpeed - The speed at which the gif should fade at. This is the value the tint is changed by every frame

      • FadeGif

        public FadeGif(PGif gif)
        Create a FadeGif from PGif object
        Parameters:
        gif - The gif that should be copied from

      • FadeGif

        public FadeGif(PGif gif,
               float startTint,
               float targetTint,
               float fadeSpeed)
        Creates a FadeGif with the given specifications starting from an already existing gif
        Parameters:
        gif - The gif that should be copied from
        startTint - The starting tint of the FadeGif
        targetTint - The target tint of the FadeGif
        fadeSpeed - The speed at which the gif should fade at. This is the value the tint is changed by every frame

        public void translate(int xShift,
                      int yShift)
        Move the gif by given x and y
        Parameters:
        xShift - The shift along the x axis. Positive is to the right
        yShift - The shift along the y axis. Positive is down

        Sets a target tint for the Fader to reach. The Fader will automatically start to tint towards this value
        Parameters:
        target - The target tint that you wish to reach

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Determines if the fader has reached its target tint
        Returns:
        Whether or not the target tint is equal to the current tint of the Fader

        public void removeListener()
        Removes the code that should be run on reaching the target tint and removes the trigger on the event the target fade is reacehd

      • fadeWhite

        public void fadeWhite(boolean fade)
        Sets whether or not the window should fade to white
        Parameters:
        fade - Whether or not the window should fade to white. True means white, false means black
